metadata.title: CVE-2023-24056 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
In pkgconf through 1.9.3, variable duplication can cause unbounded stringexpansion due to incorrect checks inlibpkgconf/tuple.c:pkgconf_tuple_parse. For example, a .pc file containinga few hundred bytes can expand to one billion bytes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-24056` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpkgconf3 - 1.8.1-1ubuntu2
pkg-config - 1.8.1-1ubuntu2
pkgconf - 1.8.1-1ubuntu2
pkgconf-bin - 1.8.1-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pkgconf package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8.1-1ubuntu2').
